On Tue, 28 Sep 2004 20:25:06 -0000, Eric <avatar_x@...> wrote:

> Junit is a new tool that I have been told to examine and see how
> well it will integrate into our existing applications we are using.
>
> So I was curious if any of you have had the opportunity to try it
> out with BroadVision and if so how did you find it to interact with
> the BV servers. I know this is a rather broad question but I was
> just wondering if you found it to be an effective tool when used in
> conjunction with BV or if it requires a rather long and involved
> process of setting it up and getting broadvision to interact with
> junit?

JUnit /can/ be used to test anything that is Java, it can even be used to  
test non-Java apps.  The proof of whether or not it is suited to a  
particular need is an exercise left to the reader.  You are correct that  
your question is very broad.  A better answer may come if you take the  
time to define your needs to us.

-- 
Jason Rogers
